meanings.definition: A shelter on the deck of a ship containing the steering wheel and navigation equipment.
meanings.sent1: The pilothouse on the ship protected the captain from the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The sailors gathered in the pilothouse to chart the course of the voyage.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the crew played cards in the pilothouse to stay dry.
meanings.sent4: The pilothouse was like a safe haven amidst the turbulent sea.
meanings.sent5: The shiny instruments in the pilothouse gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A small structure on the roof of a building used for observation or control.
meanings.sent1: From the pilothouse, the guard could see the entire street below.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a beautiful pilothouse for overseeing the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons found a cozy spot to nest in the pilothouse on top of the building.
meanings.sent4: The pilothouse perched on the rooftop like a watchful bird.
meanings.sent5: The view from the pilothouse was breathtaking, with city lights twinkling below.

meanings.definition: A compartment on an aircraft for the pilot and crew.
meanings.sent1: The pilot checked the controls in the pilothouse before takeoff.
meanings.sent2: Passengers were not allowed to enter the pilothouse during the flight.
meanings.sent3: The flight attendant accidentally locked herself out of the pilothouse.
meanings.sent4: The pilothouse of the plane felt like a separate world above the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The hum of the engines filled the pilothouse as the plane soared through the sky.
